result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon G. Gerke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Shall undergo and follow through with any counseling as directed by agent
Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon G. Gerke

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Called cases 15CF164 and 16CF42. Defendant Brandon G. Gerke in court, in custody with attorney Bradley J Jansen.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Klomberg heard, agreement reached. Court questions def. Jessica Masse swrn, makes stmnt. Michelle Huebert swrn, makes stmnt. Atty Klomberg heard. Atty Jansen heard. Def makes stmnt. Court heard and imposes sent of:
15CF164
 ct. 1
100 months DOC - stayed for 30 days
40 months IC
60 months ES
Consecutive to Milwaukee Cty case 14CF1526

15CF164 ct. 5 and ct. 9, 16CF42 ct. 1
Sent w/h
3yrs P&P consecutive to ct. 1 in case 15CF164
Full time employment
Absolute Sobriety
Treatment by agent
$285 in buy funds to be collected by Dodge County Clerk of Courts
Costs
DNA Sample
Sentencing hearing on April 5, 2016 at 09:30 am.

(15CF164 & 16CF42) Defendant Brandon G. Gerke in court, in custody with attorney Bradley J Jansen.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions def and reviews chgs and pens; guilty plea entered in 15CF164 cnts 1, 5 & 9 and 16CF42 cnt 1; Court accepts pleas and finds defendant guilty and orders remaining counts dismissed and read in; parties heard on scheduling; sentencing to be set in Br 4;  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Plea hearing on March 18, 2016 at 11:00 am.

w/15CF164:  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

(15CF164 & 16CF42) Defendant Brandon G. Gerke in custody via video with attorney Ramneek Button (will appoint on 16CF42); James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court conducts Initial on 16CF42; State heard on bond $50,000 Cash, notes $10,000 Cash ; Atty. Button response; Court orders $25,000 CASH Bond to cover both cases, same conditions as previously ordered; PH requested within time limits in 16CF42; PH 3/17/16 at 8:30am in Br. 1; JT 4/5/16 at 8:30am in Br. 4 remains in 15CF164

16CF42 (Initial) & 15CF164 (Bail Modif.): Attorney Bradley J Jansen appeared. Def. FTA for Initial and Bail Modification motion; State appears by Kurt Klomberg; Atty. Jansen heard - Def. wants cont. to Monday to arrange child care, Def. has active warrant in Milwaukee County; Atty. Jansen heard on bail forfeiture request; State requests warrant - Def. has been in active warrant status since December; Court issues warrant for arrest in new case (16CF42) and Court issues warrant in 15CF164; Court wants testimony to forfeit the $10,000 Cash bail; State calls Deputy Robbie Weinferter, s/t; witness excused; Atty. Jansen argument - requests only half of bond forfeited and Def. given deadline to turn self in; State argument - requests forfeiture of entire $10,000 cash posted; Court orders full $10,000 cash bond forfeited in 15CF164 and authorizes warrant; discussion on JT date; Court notes JT remain for 10 days and DA's office to notify court if JT needs to be removed; State to draft order on forfeiture of bond
